en: What's so funny?
What's it like?
What're you good at?
What was I wearing at that time? Do you remember?

en: What kind of costumes did you buy for the children?

en: What else does Tom want?
What else does Tom need?
What do you want me to say?
What do you know about Tom?
What do you know about the CIA?

en: What do I do next?
What did you see?
What did Tom want?
What did Tom say?
What did Tom say about me?
What did Tom know?
What did Tom do?
What did I ever do to you?

What are you writing?
What are you working on?
What are you still doing here?
What are you guys up to?
What are you afraid of?
We're attracted to each other, aren't we?
Was Tom murdered?
Was that Tom who was playing the organ at church last Sunday?
zh: 上周日在教堂弹风琴的是汤姆吗？

en: These aren't yours, are they?
Is Tom with you?
Is Tom going to get out of prison any time soon?
Is this seat open?
Is that Tom?
Is that important?
Is that a problem?
Is everybody OK?
I can see you're frightened.

en: I can take a message.
I can't believe you.
I can't do any more.
I can't do it alone.
I can't draw a bird.
I can't go with you tonight.
zh: 今晚我不能和你一起去。

en: I can't work with you if you don't trust me.
zh: 如果你不信任我，我就没法和你共事。

en: I checked it twice.
I come here every day.
I couldn't lie to you.
I couldn't say no.
I did nothing.
I didn't expect you so soon.
I didn't kill anyone.
I didn't mean to embarrass you.

en: I didn't need your help.
I didn't notice Tom had gone.
zh: 我没注意到汤姆已经走了。

en: I didn't say anything.
I didn't want to go to your wedding.
zh: 我不想去参加你的婚礼。

en: I didn't write anything.
I do feel pretty good.
I don't believe anything Tom says.
zh: 我不相信汤姆说的任何话。

en: I don't believe this.
I don't even know how old Tom is.
zh: 我甚至都不知道汤姆多大了。

en: I don't even know where Tom lives.

en: I don't feel like doing that now.
I don't feel like watching TV now.
I don't feel sorry for Tom.

en: I don't have any allergies.
I don't have time to explain.
I don't have to be here.
I don't have to go to school tomorrow.
I don't know how old that bridge is.
zh: 我不知道那座桥有多少年历史了。

en: I don't know how old Tom is.
I don't know what happened to Tom.
zh: 我不知道汤姆出什么事了。

en: I don't know what happened.
I don't know what that is.
I don't know what you want me to do.
zh: 我不知道你想让我做什么。

en: I don't know who Tom's wife is.
zh: 我不知道汤姆的老婆是谁。

en: I don't know why I did that.
zh: 我不知道我为什么要那么做。

en: I don't like anything Tom does.
zh: 汤姆做的任何事我都不喜欢。

en: I don't recognize it.
I don't think this is funny.
zh: 我觉得这一点都不好笑。

en: I don't think Tom is selfish.
I don't trust anyone.
I don't want anyone to touch this.
zh: 我不想让任何人碰这个。

en: I don't want to hurt anyone.
I don't want to live with you anymore.
zh: 我不想再跟你一起住了。

en: I don't want to talk about that.
I don't want you to do that.
I donated blood this afternoon.
I feel bad about what I said.
zh: 我对我说的那些话感到很抱歉。

en: I forgot to tell you where I live.
zh: 我忘了告诉你我住哪儿了。

en: I found out where Tom lives.
zh: 我打听到汤姆住哪儿了。

en: I found out where Tom's airplane crashed.

en: I found out why Tom was late.

en: I found this under your bed.
zh: 我在你的床底下发现了这个。

en: I found your diary.
I had a really great time tonight.
zh: 我今晚玩得真的很开心。

en: I had my ears checked.
I had my eyes checked.
I hate cops like him.
zh: 我讨厌像他那样的警察。

en: I hate this part of the movie.
I have a lot more experience than Tom does.
zh: 我的经验比汤姆丰富得多。

en: I have a lot more homework than Tom does.
zh: 我的作业比汤姆多得多。

en: I have a son in junior high school.
I have another question.
I have back problems.
I have my own theory.
I have no idea how it works.
zh: 我完全不知道它是怎么运作的。

en: I have so many ideas.
I have to change into my work clothes.
I have to do it by myself.
I have to do this alone.
I have to get home.
I have to go.
I have to see Tom.
I haven't seen Tom in months.
zh: 我已经好几个月没见汤姆了。

en: I haven't talked to Tom yet.
I hear Tom is getting married.
I heard about the problems Tom caused.
zh: 我听说汤姆惹的那些麻烦了。

en: I heard that Tom crashed the party.
zh: 我听说汤姆去蹭派对了。

en: I hope that Tom will never do that again.
zh: 我希望汤姆以后再也不要那样做了。

en: I invited Tom to the party.
zh: 我邀请了汤姆来参加派对。

en: I just couldn't say no.
I just didn't believe Tom.
I just didn't believe what Tom said.
zh: 我就是不相信汤姆说的话。

en: I just feel like relaxing.
I just need a minute.
I just need to find Tom.
I just remembered that I was supposed to buy a loaf of bread.
zh: 我刚想起我本来该买条面包的。

en: I just remembered there's something I have to do.
zh: 我刚想起我还有点事要做。

en: I just want to go home.
I just want to rest.
I just want to talk.
I just wanted to know what time Tom would arrive.
zh: 我只是想知道汤姆几点到。

en: I keep thinking about Tom.
I knew you'd be mad.
I knew you'd get here in time.
zh: 我就知道你会准时赶到这儿的。

en: I knew you'd like it.
I know a guy who plays the guitar fairly well.
zh: 我认识个哥们儿吉他弹得挺好。

en: I know all about you.
I know that this is important.
I know that Tom says he doesn't like me.
zh: 我知道汤姆说他不喜欢我。

en: I know this is hard.
I know Tom says he doesn't like me.
zh: 我知道汤姆说他不喜欢我。

en: I know what's right.
I know what's wrong.
I know you don't ever want to see me again.
zh: 我知道你再也不想见到我了。

en: I know you're right.
I left you a message.
I like your shirt.
I locked the front door.
I lost an earring.
I thought I told you to stay in the car.
zh: 我以为我让你待在车里呢。

en: I thought you grew up in Boston.
zh: 我以为你是在波士顿长大的。

en: I thought you said you used to live in Boston.
zh: 我以为你说你以前住在波士顿。

en: I thought you were from Boston.
I thought you were going to be at home last night.
I told Tom the truth.
I told you I don't know how to do that.
zh: 我跟你说过我不会那个。

en: I want to be here.
I want to go back.
I want to meet Tom.
I want to see Tom.
I want to watch what's on TV right now.
zh: 我想看看现在电视上在演什么。

en: I want Tom to be happy.
I wanted Tom to stay longer, but he had to leave.
zh: 我本来想让汤姆多留一会儿，但他得走了。

en: I wish I could live in a house that nice.
zh: 我要是能住在那样的好房子里就好了。

en: I wish I had more time.
zh: 要是能有更多时间就好了。

en: I wish you'd come sooner.
Tom is reading the Bible.
Tom doesn't find this as funny as Mary does.
zh: 汤姆觉得这事没玛丽觉得的那么好笑。

en: Tom kissed Mary on her forehead.
Tom picked up the glass of water and took a sip.
zh: 汤姆端起水杯喝了一口。

en: Tom put on some rubber gloves so he wouldn't leave fingerprints.
zh: 汤姆戴上了橡胶手套，免得留下指纹。

en: That guy, he said he had a wide, prominent forehead, but in fact, its his hairline that's receding.
zh: 那家伙说他额头宽大饱满，其实是发际线往后移了。

en: All overs are ill.
I'd have let you know if I had known.
zh: 我要是早知道的话，肯定就告诉你了。

en: I'd like to stay as long as possible.
zh: 我想尽可能待得久一点。

en: I'd like you to come with us.
zh: 我想让你和我们一起来。

en: I'd love to marry you, but my family won't let me.
zh: 我想跟你结婚，但我家里人不让。

en: I'd recommend taking a break.
I'll be fine.
I'll be here.
I'll come back for my suitcase this afternoon.
zh: 我今天下午回来拿行李。

en: I'll explain everything to you later.
zh: 我晚点再跟你解释清楚。

en: I'll give you a ride home.
I'll go ask Tom.
I'll go first.
I'll handle it.
I'll let Tom know.
I'll look into it.
I'll pick you up at 2:30.
I'll tell you.
I'll wait here.
I'll walk you out.
I'm a little busy.
I'm a musician.
I'm a patient man.
I'm a photographer.
I'm afraid I don't understand.
I'm afraid it's going to take a bit more time.
I'm all alone now.
I'm awfully tired.
I'm calling from a cell phone.
I'm getting better.
I'm going to be late for work.
I'm going to tell Tom the truth.
I'm going with Tom.
I'm here because I want to be.
zh: 我来这儿是因为我想来。

en: I'm here every night.
I'm here to ask for your help.
I'm in the attic.
I'm just lazy.
I'm mad at you.
I'm not going to tell you what to do.
zh: 我不会告诉你该怎么做。

en: I'm not going to tell you where Tom is.
zh: 我不会告诉你汤姆在哪。

en: I'm not here to arrest you.
I'm not really hungry.
I'm not saying what she did was the right thing to do.
I'm not scared.
I'm not so sure Tom is right.
zh: 我不太确定汤姆是对的。

en: I'm not so sure Tom is wrong.
zh: 我不太确定汤姆是错的。

en: I'm not sure how much they are expecting me to donate.
zh: 我不确定他们希望我捐多少。

en: I'm not the only one who likes Tom.
zh: 喜欢汤姆的不止我一个。

en: I'm over eighteen.
I'm pretty sure that building was built in 1987.
zh: 我挺肯定那栋楼是1987年盖的。

en: I'm pretty sure that tower is 330 meters tall.
zh: 我挺肯定那座塔有330米高。

en: I'm ready.
I'm really good at figuring out these kinds of problems.
zh: 我挺擅长解决这类问题的。

en: I'm sick of eating out every night.
zh: 我受够了天天在外面吃饭。

en: I'm sick of this.
I'm so embarrassed.
I'm tired. It's been a long day.
zh: 我累了，今天忙了一整天。

en: I've just finished eating breakfast.
I think I will change jobs.
I think I'll change jobs.
What's the productivity per person?
Tom is the one who caused the accident.
Tom carried two boxes into the storage room.
zh: 汤姆搬了两个箱子进储藏室。

en: I'm not worried about Tom. I'm worried about Mary.
zh: 我不担心汤姆，我担心的是玛丽。

en: We're not soldiers.
We were worried.
We were supposed to help Tom yesterday afternoon.
zh: 我们昨天下午本该帮汤姆的。

en: We understand.
We should set a trap.
We must stop Tom before he kills himself.
zh: 我们必须在汤姆自杀前阻止他。

en: We must stop Tom before he hurts himself.
zh: 我们必须在汤姆伤到自己前阻止他。

en: We might not need to go to the supermarket today.
zh: 我们今天可能不需要去超市。

en: We might not need to attend the meeting on Monday.
zh: 我们周一可能不需要参加会议。

en: We might need to help Tom.
zh: 我们可能需要帮帮汤姆。

en: We have some new products we'd like you to see.
zh: 我们有些新产品想让你看看。

en: We didn't expect it to take this long.
zh: 我们没想到要花这么长时间。

en: My grandmother had an operation in Germany.
zh: 我奶奶在德国做了个手术。

en: I need to charge my cell phone.
Tom wants revenge.
How strange!
Stand back!
He's a bit shy.
She's a bit shy.
Hang on!
I'm looking forward to seeing you in your cap and gown.
zh: 我很期待看到你穿学士服的样子。

en: Let's grab a quick lunch at that small coffeeshop near the park.
zh: 咱们去公园旁边那个小咖啡馆随便吃点午饭吧。

en: It's too easy.
It's too dark.
It's not true.
It's not mine.
It's not fair.
It's a weapon.
I intend to change jobs.
You're weird.
You're so picky.
You're so bossy.
You're a liar.
You won't find anything here.

en: You should've gone there by yourself.
You really look great.
You look relieved.
You dropped something.
It looks very expensive.
It might be a good idea to get some sleep.
It was worth it.
That's a joke.
That's cool.
That's wonderful.
When I first met Tom, I was eighteen.
zh: 我第一次见汤姆的时候才十八岁。

en: Welcome to Boston.
This is weird.
This is useless.
This is not a game.
This is my baby.
This is a joke.
Thanks for the help.
Please pull over.
Please don't go.
Perhaps you're right.
Oh, by the way, I have something to show you.
zh: 噢，对了，我有个东西想给你看。

en: No one said anything.
Mary thought she could change Tom.
zh: 玛丽觉得她能改变汤姆。

en: All I can do at the moment is wait.
Don't take it too literally.
You must promise me something.
You just have to promise me one thing.
zh: 你只要答应我一件事就行。

en: The photos are taken by a pro, so they'll turn out well.
zh: 照片是专业人士拍的，效果肯定很好。

en: He stopped resisting, and resigned himself to his fate.
Yesterday I was told I looked like Kohei Tanaka.
zh: 昨天有人说我长得像田中公平。

en: A bee is buzzing around.
If the alarm rings, walk, don't run.
zh: 如果警报响了，用走的，别跑。

en: Let's go tomorrow afternoon.
You must do as I say.
Do you trust Tom?
He pushed her away.
Tom has a heavy German accent.
I don't want to get out of bed.
They don't want to get out of bed.
What kind of American accent does Tom have?
zh: 汤姆说的是哪种美国口音？

en: Tom is a New Yorker, but he doesn't have a New York accent.
zh: 汤姆是纽约人，但他没有纽约口音。

en: It's very easy to sound natural in your own native language, and very easy to sound unnatural in your non-native language.
zh: 说母语很容易听着自然，但说外语就很自然地会听着别扭。

en: I did it willingly.
Eat your vegetables.
I never want to see her again.
I came by taxi from the station.
zh: 我是从车站打车过来的。

en: Tom took off his tie and started unbuttoning his shirt.
zh: 汤姆摘掉领带，开始解衬衫扣子。

en: Tom took a swig of rum.
zh: 汤姆灌了一大口朗姆酒。

en: A young girl on crutches asked Tom where he lived.
zh: 一个拄着拐杖的小女孩问汤姆住在哪儿。

en: A middle-aged woman with a knapsack on her back seemed to be looking for a place to sit down.
zh: 一个背着包的中年妇女好像在找地方坐。

en: The dog ran here and there.
I want to go to the same school that Tom plans to go to.
zh: 我想去汤姆打算去的那所学校。

en: I want to buy the same car that Tom wants to buy.
zh: 我想买汤姆想买的那款车。

en: He removed his shirt.
How beautiful!
How clever Tom is!
How lovely!
Keep it.
Listen.
Take it.
Tell me.
I'm going out.
Be proud of yourself.
She called her cat Tatoeba.
He likes Indian food.
Call us.
Be nice.
Be kind.
Be fair.
Her heart was beating wildly.
Tom lives in Gangnam.
The girl who works at that bakery is cute.
zh: 面包店里的那个女孩很可爱。

en: It's very dangerous.
It's awfully dangerous.
It's really dangerous.
There's a lovely smell coming from the kitchen!
zh: 厨房里飘出一股好香的味道！

en: I'm sore all over.
Do you want this T-shirt?
What else do you have?
A DNA test showed he was innocent.
Tom spent fifteen minutes trying to pry open the drawer with a crowbar, but he couldn't get it opened.
zh: 汤姆用撬棍撬了十五分钟抽屉，但还是没撬开。

en: I'm surprised no one else heard the gunshots.
zh: 我很惊讶竟然没有其他人听到枪声。

en: I'm old.
Does anyone know the Japanese language?
I love hard-boiled eggs.
The joint in my left elbow hurts.
I was not satisfied with life in Paris.
zh: 我对在巴黎的生活不满意。

en: Did Tom, by any chance, let Mary drive the car?
zh: 汤姆该不会是让玛丽开车了吧？

en: If you eat a lot, you'll eventually get fat.
zh: 吃这么多的话，你早晚得变胖。

en: It's annoying.
Tom said he loved Mary.
The young man came running to meet her.
zh: 那个年轻人跑着去见她。

en: It took less than five minutes.
I taught my girlfriend how to drive.
zh: 我教了我女朋友怎么开车。

en: "Tom will be here soon." "How soon?"
Wake up Tom.
The policeman aimed his gun at Tom and yelled, "Hold it right there!"
zh: 警察把枪指向汤姆，大喊道：“站住别动！”

en: Mr. Esperanto is well, isn't he?
zh: 世界语先生身体挺好的吧？

en: Where is the person that wants to eat shaved ice?
zh: 那个想吃刨冰的人在哪儿？

en: I flunked out of school.
zh: 我因为成绩太差被学校开除了。

en: I got an F in chemistry.
I got a D on my science test.
I got a C in English.
I got a B in physics.
I can't tell you how much I appreciate all your help.
zh: 我不知道该怎么感谢你帮了我这么多。

en: I appreciate your suggestion.
I appreciate your candor.
I appreciate your attention to detail.
zh: 我很欣赏你对细节的关注。

en: I appreciate your advice.
I appreciate you trying to cheer me up.
zh: 谢谢你努力想让我开心起来。

en: I appreciate you stopping by.
I appreciate you coming here.
I appreciate you calling me.
I appreciate what you did today.
zh: 我很感激你今天做的一切。

en: I've been trying to talk to you alone, but you always seem to be with other people.
zh: 我一直想找机会跟你单独谈谈，可你老是和别人在一起。

en: I've been trying to quit smoking.
I've been trying to picture the rest of my life with you.
zh: 我一直在想象和你共度余生的样子。

en: I've been trying to imagine my life without you.
zh: 我一直在试着想象没有你的生活会是什么样。

en: I've been trying to get a little exercise every day.
zh: 我一直试着每天都运动一下。

en: I've been trying to get a hold of you for the past two hours.
zh: 过去这两个小时我一直在试着联系你。

en: I've been trying to find a way to reach Tom, but I can't.
zh: 我一直在想办法联系上汤姆，但没成功。

en: I've been trying to cut down on caffeine.
zh: 我一直试着少喝点含咖啡因的饮料。

en: I've been trying to cheer Tom up.
zh: 我一直在试着让汤姆振作起来。

en: Am I right?
You look like your mother.
He was accused of stealing dinosaur bones.
zh: 他被指控偷窃恐龙骨头。

en: Don't say such things.
I'd like to work with Tom.
I'd like to try some Thai food.
I'd like to try doing this by myself.
I'd like to think about it a little bit longer.
I'd like to thank everyone for their support.
I'd like to tell you something in private.
I'd like to talk to you in my office.
zh: 我想在办公室和你谈谈。

en: I'd like to talk to you for a minute.
I'd like to talk to you about what happened at school yesterday.
zh: 我想和你谈谈昨天学校发生的事。

en: I'd like to talk to Tom alone.
I'd like to take my jacket off.
I'd like to take a short break.
I'd like to take a couple of days off next week.
I'd like to stay here with Tom.
I'd like to stay here and chat, but I have to go to a concert my kid's playing in.
zh: 我也想留下来聊天，但我得去参加我孩子的音乐会。

en: I'd like to stay and chat, but I've got a meeting to go to.
zh: 我也想留下来聊天，但我得去开个会。

en: I'd like to speak with Tom.
I'd like to speak with Tom alone.
I'd like to speak to Tom again.
I'd like to sit near the front.
I'd like to see you in my office.
I'd like to see Tom immediately.
I'd like to see Tom at 2:30.
I'd like to put the past behind us.
zh: 我想让过去的事情都过去吧。

en: I'd like to perform at Carnegie Hall someday.
zh: 我希望有一天能在卡内基大厅演出。

en: I'd like to introduce you to some of my friends.
zh: 我想把你介绍给我的几个朋友。

en: I'd like to hire you to paint a portrait of me.
zh: 我想请你为我画一幅肖像画。

en: I'd like to hear that song again.
I'd like to hear more about that.
zh: 我想多了解一点那件事。

en: I'd like to have Tom and Mary over for dinner.
zh: 我想请汤姆和玛丽来家里吃晚饭。

en: I'd like to have a word with Tom.
I'd like to have a few minutes alone with Tom.
zh: 我想和汤姆单独待几分钟。

en: I'd like to come along if you don't mind.
zh: 如果你不介意的话，我想一起去。

en: I'd like to buy some earplugs.
I'd like to buy a present for my son. Do you have any good ideas?
zh: 我想给我儿子买个礼物，你有什么好主意吗？

en: I'd like to borrow about three hundred thousand dollars.
zh: 我想借大约三十万美元。

en: I'd like to be your boyfriend.
I'd like to be alone.
I'd like to avoid this problem in the future.
zh: 我想在以后避免这个问题。

en: I'd like to ask you about Tom.
zh: 我想向你打听一下汤姆的情况。

en: I'd like to ask Tom to answer a few questions.
zh: 我想请汤姆回答几个问题。

en: I'd like to ask Tom if he feels the same way.
zh: 我想问问汤姆他是不是也这么想。

en: I'd like to ask Tom a few questions if I may.
zh: 如果可以的话，我想问汤姆几个问题。

en: "You're pretty good at English, aren't you?" "I'd like to think so."
zh: “你的英语挺棒的，是吧？”“我也希望如此。”

en: Look at that!
I can't prune this tree. It's too tall.
zh: 我没法修剪这棵树，它太高了。

en: Which ice cream shop are you going to?
He's started writing a novel.
He has started to write a novel.
Anna has chestnut brown hair, but Magdalena has blonde hair.
zh: 安娜有一头栗色的头发，但玛格达莱娜是金发。

en: Anna's hair is brown, but Magdalena's is blonde.
zh: 安娜的头发是棕色的，但玛格达莱娜的是金色的。

en: The rain has let up, so we can begin.
zh: 雨小了，我们可以开始了。

en: This is the key that opened that door.
I left Shanghai last year and have not yet been back.
zh: 我去年离开上海后就没回去过。

en: My house is near the school.
I too have been to New York.
I came on foot.
There's a coffee shop in front of the station.
zh: 车站前面有一家咖啡馆。

en: I thought Tom would want butter on his toast.
zh: 我以为汤姆想在吐司上抹黄油。

en: I thought Tom would be in his room.
zh: 我以为汤姆会在他的房间里。

en: I thought Tom would be in Boston by now.
zh: 我以为汤姆现在已经到波士顿了。

en: I thought Tom had gotten over Mary.
zh: 我以为汤姆已经放下玛丽了。

en: I thought Tom had a dog.
I thought Tom had a day off.
Stop contributing to Tatoeba. You're addicted.
zh: 别再给Tatoeba做贡献了，你都上瘾了。

en: We collect stamps from all around the world.
zh: 我们收集世界各地的邮票。

en: The little girl was crying at the top of her lungs trying to find her mom.
zh: 那个小女孩为了找妈妈，哭得声嘶力竭。

en: Our company is a limited company.
zh: 我们公司是有限责任公司。

en: Please translate this text from Japanese to French.
zh: 请把这段文字从日语翻译成法语。

en: This is cheap.
Please tell me the bank's number.
Sometimes telling the truth hurts.
zh: 有时候说实话挺伤人的。

en: Tom thinks that volleyball is more fun than basketball.
zh: 汤姆觉得排球比篮球有意思。

en: I sent this letter to my uncle.
zh: 我把这封信寄给我的叔叔了。

en: Excuse me, do you speak English?
Excuse me. Can you speak English?
zh: 打扰一下，你会说英语吗？

en: I wonder how Tom put up with Mary for so many years.
zh: 我真纳闷汤姆是怎么忍了玛丽这么些年的。

en: Please wait a little while.
It's no use trying to convince Tom.
We can't afford to take chances.
I can't afford to wait around.
We can't afford to waste any more time.
zh: 我们不能再浪费时间了。

en: I can't be in two places at the same time.
zh: 我没法同时待在两个地方。

en: We can't be sure which door Tom will come through.
zh: 我们不确定汤姆会从哪扇门进来。

en: I can't be sure, but I think Tom likes Mary.
zh: 我不敢肯定，但我觉得汤姆喜欢玛丽。

en: I can't be sure, but I think Tom wants to go out with Mary.
zh: 我不确定，但我觉得汤姆想约玛丽出去。

en: Tom can't bear to look at Mary.
You can't beat me, Tom. I've been playing tennis since I was a kid.
zh: 你赢不了我的，汤姆，我从小就开始打网球了。

en: I can't believe anyone ate what Tom cooked.
zh: 我真不敢相信有人会吃汤姆做的饭。

en: I can't believe that.
I can't believe that's what's really troubling Tom.
zh: 我不敢相信那竟然就是困扰汤姆的事。

en: I can't believe Tom did that to Mary.
zh: 我真不敢相信汤姆竟然会对玛丽做出那种事。

en: I can't believe Tom is dead.
I can't believe Tom is getting married.
zh: 我不敢相信汤姆要结婚了。

en: I can't believe Tom is really planning on doing this.
zh: 我简直不敢相信汤姆真的打算这么做。

en: I can't believe Tom knows where Mary lives.
zh: 我真不敢相信汤姆竟然知道玛丽住哪儿。

en: I can't believe Tom really said no to me.
zh: 我不敢相信汤姆竟然拒绝了我。

en: Tom can't believe what he's just seen.
zh: 汤姆不敢相信他刚才看到的一切。

en: You can't blame yourself.
I can't break this code.
Tom can't bring himself to say no.
You can't buy anything interesting in this store.
zh: 这家店里买不到什么有意思的东西。

en: You can't buy it anymore.
I can't carry this suitcase. It's too heavy.
zh: 这个手提箱我提不动，太重了。

en: Tom can't come to the phone.
I can't contact Tom.
I can't convince Tom.
I can't dance either.
You can't dance, can you?
I can't dance.
I can't decide which car to buy.
I can't disclose that information yet.
zh: 我现在还不能透露那个信息。

en: I can't do any more than that.
I can't do anything for Tom.
I can't do it right now.
I can't do it today.
I can't do that now.
Tom can't do that.
I can't do this job alone.
zh: 这活儿我一个人干不了。

en: I can't do this work alone.
zh: 这份工作我一个人完成不了。

en: I can't eat.
Tom can't figure out how to get the box open.
zh: 汤姆琢磨不出怎么把盒子打开。

en: I can't get my money out of the bank today.
zh: 我今天没法从银行取钱。

en: We can't go right now.
I can't go there unless I go with Tom.
zh: 除非跟汤姆一起，否则我去不了那儿。

en: I can't go.
She refused to speak English.
I can't imagine life without Tom.
zh: 我无法想象没有汤姆的生活。

en: I can't kiss you now.
Skip it.
Five times five is twenty-five.
Five times five is twenty five.
Ask Tom.
Back off!
Be still.
Come on.
Leave it.
Marry me.
Use this.
Warn Tom.
Watch how I do it.
I can't look at Tom.
I can't make ends meet now.
We can't pull this off without Tom.
You can't put it off any longer.
I can't reach things on the top shelf.
zh: 我够不到架子最上面的东西。

en: We can't reach Tom by phone, so send him an email.
zh: 我们打不通汤姆的电话，所以给他发封邮件吧。

en: I can't really help you at all.
zh: 我真的帮不上你什么忙。

en: I can't really remember.
Tom can't refuse.
I can't remember anything about that night.
zh: 我那天晚上的事儿一点儿都不记得了。

en: I can't remember anything.
I can't remember the password I used for this website.
zh: 我不记得我这个网站用的密码了。

en: I can't remember why I was there.
zh: 我不记得我当时为什么在那儿了。

en: We can't see any stars tonight.
zh: 今晚一颗星星也看不见。

en: Tom can't seem to keep out of trouble.
zh: 汤姆好像总是在惹麻烦。

en: I can't sell that to you.
I can't stand babies crying.
I can't stand liars.
I can't stand listening to loud music.
zh: 我受不了听那种大声的音乐。

en: We can't start second-guessing ourselves.
zh: 我们不能开始自我怀疑。

en: I can't stop thinking about Tom.
I can't tell you how long I've been waiting for this.
zh: 我没法告诉你我等这一刻等了多久。

en: I can't tell you.
We can't tow this car.
We can't trust anyone now.
zh: 现在我们谁都不能相信了。

en: I can't trust you.
I can't understand why Tom doesn't want to go with us.
zh: 我不明白汤姆为什么不想跟我们一起去。

en: Littering is prohibited.
Because it started to rain, I couldn't use my camera.
zh: 因为下雨了，我没法用相机。

en: Her son is sick.
I only just noticed it.
What do you want to ask me?
I have no reason to lie to you.
He's our only suspect.
zh: 他是我们唯一的嫌疑人。

en: Tom is lying on his back.
Once I started college, I barely had time to sleep.
zh: 上大学以后，我几乎都没时间睡觉。

en: Women and children first!
That is no longer possible.
That is not possible anymore.
That's no longer possible.
That isn't possible anymore.
Do you really think Tom's wounds are self-inflicted?
zh: 你真的觉得汤姆的伤是他自己弄的吗？

en: The school principal suspended Tom for two days.
zh: 校长让汤姆停学了两天。

en: Tom bit his lip.
Tom couldn't believe that no one laughed at his jokes.
zh: 汤姆不敢相信竟然没一个人笑他的笑话。

en: Tom couldn't get the heavy doors open.
zh: 汤姆打不开那扇沉重的大门。

en: Tom couldn't keep a straight face.
Tom doesn't get out much.
Tom doesn't know how to use a snorkel.
zh: 汤姆不会用潜水呼吸管。

en: Tom has a longer beard than John does.
zh: 汤姆的胡子比约翰的长。

en: Tom has decided to ignore your advice.
zh: 汤姆决定不听你的建议。

en: Tom heard the sound of breaking glass.
zh: 汤姆听到了玻璃碎掉的声音。

en: Tom pinned a white corsage on Mary's dress.
zh: 汤姆在玛丽的裙子上别了一朵白色的胸花。

en: Why does Tom have such a negative attitude?
zh: 汤姆的态度怎么这么消极？

en: I thought a game of tennis might be fun.
zh: 我觉得打场网球应该挺好玩的。

en: I thought about giving my saxophone to Tom as a gift.
zh: 我想过把我的萨克斯送给汤姆当礼物。

en: I thought about throwing it away, but decided to keep it.
zh: 我想过把它扔了，但最后还是决定留着。

en: I thought about you a lot.
I thought for a moment Tom was going to start laughing.
zh: 有那么一瞬间，我以为汤姆要笑出来了。

en: I thought going out to eat together would cheer you up.
zh: 我以为一起出去吃顿饭能让你开心点。

en: I thought I could change your mind.
zh: 我以为我能让你改变主意。

en: I thought I had a day off.
I thought I had the right to fire anyone I wanted to.
zh: 我以为我想开除谁就开除谁。

en: I thought I heard someone banging on the wall.
zh: 我以为我听到有人在砸墙。

en: I thought I heard someone knocking on the door.
zh: 我以为我听到有人在敲门。

en: I thought I heard voices.
zh: 我以为我听到有人说话的声音。

en: I thought I recognized Tom.
I thought I saw something.
zh: 我以为我看见什么东西了。

en: I thought I smelled bacon.
zh: 我以为我闻到培根味儿了。

en: I thought I told you not to call Tom at school.
zh: 我以为我跟你说过别在学校给汤姆打电话。

en: I thought I told you to go to bed.
zh: 我以为我让你去睡觉了。

en: I thought I told you to keep the door closed.
zh: 我以为我让你把门关好。

en: I thought I told you to stay away from my computer.
zh: 我以为我跟你说过别动我的电脑。

en: I thought I told you to trim your beard.
zh: 我以为我让你修修胡子。

en: I thought I was dreaming.
I thought I would be nervous, but I was cool as a cucumber.
zh: 我以为我会很紧张，但我当时特别淡定。

en: I thought I'd never be happy again.
zh: 我以为我再也开心不起来了。

en: I thought it was a mistake to tell Tom where we buried the treasure.
zh: 我觉得告诉汤姆我们把宝藏埋在哪儿是个错误。

en: I thought it was a secret.
I thought it was something like that.
zh: 我以为差不多就是那样。

en: I thought it would be an opportunity for you to improve your French.
zh: 我以为这会是个让你提高法语的机会。

en: I thought it would be fun for us to go skiing together.
zh: 我以为咱们一起去滑雪会挺好玩的。

en: I thought it'd get easier.
zh: 我以为以后会慢慢变容易的。

en: I thought maybe you'd have an idea.
zh: 我以为你可能会有主意。

en: I thought something was odd.
I thought that system was abolished last year.
zh: 我以为那个制度去年就废除了。

en: I thought that was kind of strange.
I thought that went well.
zh: 我觉得进行得挺顺利的。

en: I thought the game was over.
zh: 我以为比赛已经结束了。

en: I thought the police were looking for Tom.
I thought the same thing.
I thought this building had a sprinkler system.
zh: 我以为这栋楼有自动喷淋系统。

en: I thought this might come in handy.
zh: 我想着这东西可能用得着。

en: I thought Tom and Mary were going to use me as a hostage.
zh: 我以为汤姆和玛丽要拿我当人质。

en: I thought Tom might be sick.
I thought Tom might do that.
zh: 我觉得汤姆可能会那么做。

en: I thought Tom was a doctor.
I thought Tom was asleep.
I thought Tom was Canadian.
zh: 我以为汤姆是加拿大人。

en: I thought Tom was joking.
I thought Tom was still in jail.
I thought Tom was your best friend.
zh: 我以为汤姆是你最好的朋友。

en: I thought Tom would be here by now.
zh: 我以为汤姆这会儿应该已经到了。

en: I thought Tom would never see you again.
zh: 我以为汤姆再也不会见你了。

en: I thought we could eat out on the patio.
zh: 我以为咱们可以在露台上吃。

en: I thought we had agreed that you would study harder.
zh: 我以为咱们说好了你要更努力学习的。

en: I thought we were going out to dinner.
zh: 我以为咱们要去外面吃晚饭。

en: I thought we were going to die.
I thought we were going to win.
I thought we were supposed to eat lunch together.
zh: 我以为我们要一起吃午饭。

en: I thought we were supposed to meet Tom at 2:30.
zh: 我以为我们要两点半和汤姆见面。

en: I thought we would have breakfast together.
zh: 我以为我们要一起吃早饭。

en: I thought you always played football on Saturday.
zh: 我还以为你周六都要踢足球。

en: I thought you didn't believe in ghosts.
I thought you didn't know anything about lacrosse.
zh: 我以为你一点都不懂长曲棍球。

en: I thought you didn't know that.
zh: 我以为你不知道那件事。

en: I thought you enjoyed talking about baseball.
zh: 我还以为你挺喜欢聊棒球的。

en: I thought you guys were planning on coming to my party.
zh: 我以为你们打算来参加我的派对。

en: I thought you liked being alone.
zh: 我还以为你喜欢一个人待着。

en: I thought you might be able to give me a hand.
zh: 我还以为你能帮我个忙呢。

en: I thought you might be hungry, so I made some sandwiches.
zh: 我想你可能会饿，就做了点三明治。

en: I thought you might be lonely, so I came over with a bottle of wine.
zh: 我想你可能会寂寞，就带了瓶酒来看你。

en: I thought you might change your mind.
zh: 我以为你可能会改变主意。

en: I thought you might come.
I thought you might have a change of heart.
zh: 我以为你可能会回心转意。

en: I thought you might help.
I thought you might know where Tom went.
zh: 我以为你会知道汤姆去哪儿了。

en: I thought you might like to know who's coming to our party.
zh: 我想你可能想知道谁会来我们的派对。

en: I thought you might want to look over these documents.
zh: 我想你可能想过目一下这些文件。

en: I thought you might want to play a game of chess.
zh: 我想你可能想下一盘棋。

en: I thought you said you liked to try new things.
zh: 我以为你说过你喜欢尝试新鲜事物。

en: I thought you trusted me.
I thought you two would have a lot in common.
zh: 我以为你们俩会有很多共同点。

en: I thought you understood.
I thought you wanted a divorce.
I thought you wanted Tom to marry you.
zh: 我以为你想让汤姆娶你。

en: I thought you were broke.
I thought you were going out with Tom.
zh: 我以为你在跟汤姆约会。

en: I thought you were going steady with Tom.
zh: 我以为你跟汤姆在稳定交往。

en: I thought you were going to come straight home.
zh: 我以为你会直接回家的。

en: I thought you were going to do something about that.
zh: 我以为你会处理那件事。

en: I thought you were going to fix the sink.
zh: 我以为你会修那个水槽。

en: I thought you were going to keep Tom here until I got back.
zh: 我以为你会把汤姆留在这儿直到我回来。

en: I thought you were going to keep Tom occupied.
zh: I thought you were going to keep Tom occupied.

en: I thought you were going to stay home.
I thought you were going to talk to Tom about it.
zh: 我以为你会找汤姆谈谈那件事。

en: I thought you were going to wear your new suit.
zh: 我以为你会穿上你的新西装。

en: I thought you were mad at Tom.
zh: 我以为你在生汤姆的气。

en: I thought you were right.
I thought you were Tom's friend.
zh: 我以为你是汤姆的朋友。

en: I thought you weren't going to tell anyone.
zh: 我以为你不会告诉任何人。

en: I thought you'd agree with me.
zh: 我以为你会同意我的看法。

en: I thought you'd be at the bar.
I thought you'd be in your room.
I thought you'd be kind of surprised.
zh: 我还以为你会挺惊讶的。

en: I thought you'd gone to Boston.
I thought you'd probably already gone home.
zh: 我以为你可能已经回家了。

en: I thought you'd speak French better than Tom.
zh: 我以为你法语说得比汤姆好。

en: Could you please be quiet?
Next week I will go to Vancouver and visit my younger sister.
zh: 下周我要去温哥华看我妹妹。

en: I think she is good at dancing.
zh: 我觉得她跳舞跳得挺好的。

en: More time is needed for the preparations.
zh: 准备工作还需要点时间。

en: I miss my friends.
Mike likes cats.
It started again!
I hear you have friends in the CIA.
zh: 我听说你在中情局有朋友。

en: I told Mary that I just wanted to be friends.
zh: 我告诉玛丽我只想跟她做朋友。

en: I expected to make new friends when I moved to Boston.
zh: 我搬到波士顿的时候，本想能交到些新朋友。

en: I don't have any Canadian friends.
I don't have many friends.
I know Tom and Mary used to be good friends.
zh: 我知道汤姆和玛丽以前是好朋友。

en: I know Tom is your friend.
zh: 我知道汤姆是你的朋友。

en: I think that's the reason Tom doesn't have any friends.
zh: 我觉得这就是汤姆没朋友的原因。

en: I told you Tom isn't my friend.
zh: 我跟你说过，汤姆不是我朋友。

en: I'm a childhood friend of Tom's.
I'm glad I'm Tom's friend.
zh: 很高兴能成为汤姆的朋友。

en: I've been friends with Tom for many years.
zh: 我和汤姆是多年的老朋友了。

en: Where is the giraffe?
Today I started a new Esperanto course.
zh: 今天我开始上新的世界语课了。

en: I like reading mystery novels.
Come back.
Come home as soon as you can.
Come soon.
Feel this. It's really soft.
Get Tom.
Grab Tom.
Hang on.
Don't shoot.
Show me how to do that.
Tom doesn't always wear a hat.
"I hear you quit your job." "Actually, I got fired."
zh: “听说你辞职了？”“其实我是被开除的。”

en: Actually, it makes perfect sense.
Actually, Tom is his real name.
zh: 其实汤姆就是他的真名。

en: Did Tom actually say that?
Does this medicine actually help?
Does this medicine actually relieve pain?
Have you actually ever tried it?
I didn't actually forget my camera. I just didn't want to take pictures.
zh: 其实我没忘带相机，我只是不想拍。

en: I haven't actually shot anyone yet.
zh: 其实我还没对谁开过枪呢。

en: I never actually saw Tom and John fighting.
zh: 我其实从没见过汤姆和约翰打架。

en: I'm actually enjoying myself.
I'm actually here on business.
It was actually a lot more fun than I expected.
zh: 其实比我想象的有意思多了。

en: Juggling is actually a lot easier than it looks.
zh: 玩杂耍其实比看起来简单多了。

en: That was actually really fun.
We've never actually been out on a date together.
zh: 其实我们从来没一起约过会。

en: I don't have any books to read.
He wore a pirate costume for Halloween.
zh: 他万圣节穿了一身海盗服。

en: He moved close to her.
He wants to go.
Are you American?
She may speak harsh words, but deep inside she is a kind person, you know.
zh: 她虽然说话挺冲的，但其实心肠很好。

en: My English teacher recommended that I read these books.
zh: 英语老师推荐我读这些书。

en: I have to buy flowers for my girlfriend.
It's almost seven. We have to go to school.
zh: 快七点了，我们该去学校了。

en: Could you please tell me your height and weight?
zh: 麻烦告诉我你的身高和体重。

en: Could you please tell me how tall you are and how much you weigh?
zh: 麻烦说一下你多高，有多重？

en: You may be correct.
You might be correct.
The room became filled with smoke.
Tom has been working for the same website design company for years.
zh: 汤姆在同一家网页设计公司干了好几年了。

en: Can I ask you to join me?
I blame your beard.
Would you like tea or something?
I am this kid's companion.
They say Hauru tore her heart out.
zh: 听说哈尔把她的心给挖了。

en: I'll attract those guys.
Don't worry, he won't go after you.
zh: 别担心，他不会找你麻烦的。

en: Have you become an angel?
A mysterious sound approaches.
zh: 一阵奇怪的声音越来越近了。

en: Isn't he cute when he's so angry?
zh: 他生起气来不是挺可爱的吗？

en: They're nice guys.
I will serve you as an escort.
I am being followed.
It's getting full of soldiers.
The world has become dangerous.
Do you plan to spend your whole life on that store?
zh: 你打算在那家店待一辈子吗？

en: I know exactly who Tom plans to marry.
zh: 我太清楚汤姆想跟谁结婚了。

en: Please throw away your trash from this room.
zh: 请把这个房间里的垃圾扔掉。

en: Nowadays, we often use the term "senior citizen" to refer to old people.
zh: 现在我们常称呼老年人为“资深公民”。

en: Lady Gaga gave $1 million to the Red Cross to help the victims of Hurricane Sandy.
zh: Lady Gaga 捐了100万美元给红十字会，用来帮助飓风桑迪的灾民。

en: Tom and Mary always seem to be hanging out together.
zh: 汤姆和玛丽好像总是在一起混。

en: Don't ask any questions.
If you want to ask a question, please put your hand up.
Tom wanted to ask questions, but he didn't.
zh: 汤姆本来想提问的，但最后没开口。

en: Tom hardly ever asks questions.
The reporters continued to ask questions.
Are you enjoying yourself?
Are you enjoying the holidays?
Did you enjoy reading that book?
Did you enjoy the game?
zh: 那场比赛或游戏你玩得开心吗？

en: I hope you enjoy your vacation.
I hope you'll enjoy the concert.
zh: 希望你会喜欢这场演唱会。

en: You looked like you were enjoying yourself.
zh: 看起来你玩得挺开心的。

en: We could say that both of those balls are the same weight.
zh: 可以说这两个球一样重。

en: You could say that both of those balls are the same weight.
zh: 你可以说这两个球一样重。

en: You could say that both balls have the same weight.
zh: 你可以说这两个球重量相同。

en: Can you speak Japanese?
You must make your own decisions.
This is but a humble downtown store.
zh: 这不过是市中心的一家普通小店。

en: Please be leaving.
To pick a fight with her, that's courageous.
zh: 敢去招惹她，你胆子真够大的。

en: You must remain calm.
Panicking will certainly not help.
zh: 慌张是一点用也没有的。

en: Tom has trouble opening bottles.
Tom has trouble standing still.
zh: 汤姆总是没法安安静静地站着。

en: Tom has trouble keeping his temper.
zh: 汤姆很难控制住自己的脾气。

en: Tom has trouble with social interactions.
Tom seems to be unable to interact normally with other people.
zh: 汤姆似乎没法和别人正常交流。

en: Tom has a short attention span.
zh: 汤姆的注意力集中不了多久。

en: Tom often has trouble remembering things.
Tom often has trouble choosing what clothes to wear.
zh: 汤姆经常纠结该穿什么衣服。

en: Is it legal?
I assume we're doing a pretty good job since no one has complained.
zh: 既然没人投诉，我想我们干得应该还不错。

en: Tom told me I had done a pretty good job.
zh: 汤姆跟我说我干得挺不错的。

en: They must love you.
She must love you.
They must love her.
He must love her.
My family is still working, so I can't go to Texas right away.
zh: 我家人还在工作，所以我现在还不能去德州。

en: My family is still working, so they can't go to Texas right away.
zh: 我家人还在工作，所以他们现在还不能去德州。

en: I missed my family, so I went back.
Is it OK if we don't go to Costco this time?
Since I plan to have quit my job by that time, maybe I could go!
zh: 既然我打算到那时候已经辞职了，没准儿我也能去呢！

en: I thought for sure you would stay in Japan forever.
zh: 我原以为你会一辈子留在日本。

en: The Aichi sea isn't all that clean.
zh: 爱知县的海其实不怎么干净。

en: Do you want me to call the police?
Fat chance.
Oh boy, there I go again.
Please send bug reports to the following email address.
zh: 请将错误报告发送到以下邮箱。

en: You're in trouble, aren't you?
We think Tom may be in trouble.
zh: 我们觉得汤姆可能有麻烦了。

en: Tom was in trouble financially.
zh: 汤姆之前在财务上遇到了困难。

en: Tom may be in trouble.
Tom has no desire to get John in trouble.
Tom got you in trouble, didn't he?
zh: 是汤姆害你惹上麻烦的，对吧？

en: Tom got in trouble, didn't he?
Tom didn't sound as if he was in trouble.
zh: 汤姆听起来不像是遇到了麻烦。

en: The way you talk is going to get you in trouble someday.
zh: 你这种说话方式早晚会给你惹麻烦。

en: Mary thought Tom was in trouble.
zh: 玛丽觉得汤姆遇到麻烦了。

en: I'm sorry I got you in trouble.
zh: 对不起，我害你惹麻烦了。

en: I'm in trouble now.
I won't get anyone in trouble.
I think that Tom and Mary are in trouble.
zh: 我觉得汤姆和玛丽有麻烦了。

en: I know why Tom is in trouble.
zh: 我知道汤姆为什么会有麻烦。

en: I know I'm in trouble now.
zh: 我知道这下我有麻烦了。

en: I heard you might be in trouble.
zh: 我听说你可能有麻烦了。

en: Are you in trouble with the law?
What is considered impolite in one language may not be considered impolite in another language.
zh: 在一种语言里不礼貌的行为，在另一种语言里可能就没事。

en: Just the gesture is enough, thank you.
zh: 有这份心意就够了，谢谢。

en: Today is one of my friends' birthday.
zh: 今天是我一个朋友的生日。

en: She scratched her head.
Look at this.
You can call us at any time.
zh: 你随时都可以给我们打电话。

en: I suppose you don't watch very much television, right?
zh: 我猜你不怎么看电视吧？

en: The problem with the Swedish animation industry is that it is, by and large, nonexistent.
zh: 瑞典动画产业的问题在于，它基本上不存在。

en: What are you doing Sunday?
The food is good.
Come a bit closer.
Tom left.
Tom lied.
Tom lost.
Tom moved.
Who quit?
Tom quit.
Tom smiled.
Tom waved.
Tom yawned.
Who died?
Tom died.
Did I win?
Who won?
Tom won.
I won!
I didn't order fish.
Tom lived in a small fishing village.
The grand prize is a kiss from the princess.
Let's play hide and seek.
Let's give it a whirl.
Let's go take a look.
Let's keep moving.
Let's just listen.
Let's talk later.
Let's skip class.
Let's be fair.
Let's not go.
Let's go out.
Let's relax.
Let's swim.
Please give me something cold
Don't tell me that.
One way to lower the number of errors in the Tatoeba Corpus would be to encourage people to only translate into their native languages.
zh: 减少 Tatoeba 语料库错误的一个办法是鼓励大家只翻译成自己的母语。

en: I still think Tom is hiding something.
zh: 我还是觉得汤姆瞒了什么。

en: I want Mary.
I want this.
I want a job.
I want facts.
I want to die.
I want a chair.
I want a donut.
I want details.
I want to rest.
Who wants to go?
Tom didn't want it.
Do you want to come?
I want to keep that.
I wanted to be here.
Tom doesn't want it.
I wanted to help you.
I'd like some coffee.
Who wants to go next?
Tom wants to help out.
Do you want to help me?
Do you want to kiss me?
I want to believe that.
I want to buy them all.
I want to cook for you.
I want to go into town.
I want to go right now.
I want to go to Boston.
I want to speak to Tom.
I want to stay outside.
I want to wait for Tom.
I want Tom to like you.
I want Tom to see this.
I want you out of here.
I want you to be quiet.
I want you to call Tom.
zh: 我想让你给汤姆打个电话。

en: I want you to find Tom.
I want you to go there.
Tom didn't want anything.
Tom doesn't want my help.
I didn't want you to know.
Tom doesn't want anything.
Tom doesn't want me to go.
Do you want to make a deal?
Do you want to hold my hand?
I'd like to pick you up now.
We just want to talk to Tom.
zh: 我们只是想跟汤姆聊聊。

en: Why do you want to meet Tom?
You wanted this, didn't you?
Do you want to say something?
What is it you want to ask me?
I want to hear what Tom thinks.
zh: 我想听听汤姆是怎么想的。

en: Tom doesn't want Mary to leave.
What do you want for Christmas?
Is there anywhere you want to go?
Do you want to talk to me or not?
zh: 你到底想不想跟我说话？

en: I want to go to bed early tonight.
I want you to return to your seat.
I don't want to ruin Tom's holiday.
zh: 我不想毁了汤姆的假期。

en: Is that what you really want to do?
Is there something you want to say?
Tom wants to call off the marriage.
Do you want to learn to play guitar?
I don't want Tom to know about this.
zh: 我不想让汤姆知道这件事。

en: Tom wants to buy a present for Mary.
zh: 汤姆想给玛丽买个礼物。

en: Are you sure you don't want anything?
zh: 你确定什么都不想要吗？

en: I want you to take this medicine now.
zh: 我要你现在就把这药吃了。

en: Tom didn't want Mary to go to Boston.
zh: 汤姆不想让玛丽去波士顿。

en: You need to be careful.
It doesn't hurt at all.
He wants to marry my daughter.
I'm sorry about yesterday.
Most English words are unknown to most English speakers.
zh: 大多数说英语的人其实并不认识大部分的英语单词。

en: Do you want to go out with me tonight?
zh: 今晚想跟我一起出去吗？

en: I don't want to go to school tomorrow.
I have a message I want you to deliver.
zh: 我有个信儿想让你带一下。

en: Tom wanted his son to live in the city.
zh: 汤姆想让他儿子住在城里。

en: Come here. I want to show you something.
Do as I say.
I watched a Swedish movie last night.
zh: 我昨晚看了一部瑞典电影。

en: I have lost interest in studying, so I don't think there is any point in going to college.
zh: 我对读书没兴趣了，所以我觉得上大学也没什么意义。

en: Practice is tough. But, if it is for the sake of victory, then you must be able to endure.
zh: 训练很辛苦。但如果是为了赢，你就必须得忍着。

en: Because the Japanese morning train is very crowded, I would be out of breath if I caught the express train at 8 in the morning.
zh: 因为日本早上的电车特别挤，要是赶上8点那趟快车，我会被挤得喘不过气来。

en: Do not eat in class.
Since losing the match was everyone's fault, you don't have to apologize.
zh: 既然比赛输了是大家的责任，你不用道歉。

en: I pray for your happiness from the bottom of my heart.
I really appreciate that you think of me that way.
zh: 你能这么想我，我真的很感激。

en: Are you sure you don't want me to talk to Tom?
zh: 你确定不用我去跟汤姆谈谈吗？

en: You don't have to answer if you don't want to.
zh: 要是不想回答，你可以不用回答。

en: The last thing I'd ever want to do is hurt Tom.
zh: 我最不想做的事情就是伤害汤姆。

en: If they don't want this, then what do they want?
zh: 要是他们不想要这个，那他们想要什么？

en: I can't speak German at all.
Do you have plans tonight?
I want to meet with Tom.
I want to know who killed Tom.
zh: 我想知道是谁杀了汤姆。

en: I want you to tell me everything you know about Tom.
zh: 我要你把你所知道的关于汤姆的一切都告诉我。

en: Who are the judges?
One and a half years have passed since I started to learn Chinese.
zh: 我学中文已经一年半了。

en: My computer sometimes shuts down suddenly.
zh: 我的电脑有时会突然关机。

en: Mercury is the planet nearest to the sun.
zh: 水星是离太阳最近的行星。

en: The phone is ringing!
I'm watching TV.
I've had a slight sore throat since this morning. I wonder if I've caught a cold.
zh: 从今天早上起嗓子就有点疼，不知道是不是感冒了。

en: I've had a scratchy throat since this morning. I wonder if I've caught a cold.
zh: 今天早上起来嗓子痒痒的，不知道是不是感冒了。

en: That was being sold at a dollar store.
It was also sold at a 100 yen store.
zh: 百元店里也有卖那个的。

en: It would've been nice if you'd helped me a little.
zh: 你要是能稍微帮帮我就好了。
